intro: Moseleya pinnata, commonly known as the silverleaf mohavea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which helps it conserve water in arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It has a taproot system that allows it to survive in dry, rocky soils. Moseleya pinnata is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
